RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Fallen prodigy
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was born on a glitterworld falling into chaos. HISCAP father was killed in action.
HECAP struggled for a scholarship at Utmaior Academy and had to prove his right to be there. A child genius, HE was bullied as a charity case and couldn't make friends with the other kids.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Mad scientist
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Stripped of his life’s work and exiled after his unethical experiments on the survivors of the Callos IX incident were published, NAME learned the skills necessary to survive in the outer rim.
Continuing his research with nothing left to lose, he made minions to carry out the tasks that bored him.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Farm kid
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME grew up on his family's beef farm. He enjoyed working the fields and taking care of the animals.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Civil engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME was a well-known civil engineer. HISCAP job involved designing and maintaining rock fortification structures. HECAP did enough statistical analysis to keep his mind sharp.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Farmer boy
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Benjamin's parents died in a fire when he was seven. He grew up on his uncle's farm, plowing fields and doing manual labor.
He could not bear answering questions about his parents, so he replaced social contact with hard work.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Army cook
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Ben joined the army as a worker and spent most of his time cooking and repairing. While he was stationed on a dangerous planet, he underwent basic shooting and survival training.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Urbworld criminal
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Born into bad circumstance on an overpopulated urbworld, Vladimir turned to small-time crime as a way to avoid starvation and hypothermia.
Robbery and murder were daily activities for him. Vladimir learned that surviving was winning.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Urbworld politican
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
It's no secret that the Companies own much of the urbworlds, but someone has to take the bribes. Vladimir was one such figurehead.
He learned how to manipulate the hopes and dreams of the people while living comfortably in a penthouse.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Optimistic child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Kees was blessed with loving parents and a pleasant midworld life. He was an optimistic and sociable kid who loved making friends and listening to their stories. His imagination would run wild with ideas and questions.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Graphic designer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Kees' interest in artistic expression led him to become a designer. His eye for detail made him a reasonably well-known artist on his planet, though his meticulousness often led him to spend too much time perfecting a single project.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Urbworld hooligan
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME grew up in a dangerous urbworld. He quickly learned how to get his daily meal - by crime. Such means left little to no space for cooking and growing activities.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Space technician
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME finally managed to flee his criminal life by getting a maintenance job on a nearby space station. He performed multiple repairing and building operations. He also used to participate in basic research activities and often defused co-workers' arguments. He never liked doing art.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Indworld urchin
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME grew up on the streets of a world in the early stages of its industrial revolution. HECAP passed HIS days stealing, begging and tinkering with discarded machine scraps, always on the lookout for a way to escape poverty.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Doomsday pariah
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME managed to open a vault of otherworldly technology while scavenging a dig site. HE unwittingly triggered a doomsday device that cleansed the planet of all life. More interested in the tech than human life, HE boarded the vault’s spacecraft and departed to find more relics to abuse.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Mechanoid nerd
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME grew up in an urbworld as the only child of a pair of mechanoid designers. They encouraged HIS interest in the machines. Eventually, HE became obsessed with building HIS own.
Unfortunately this also lead to HIM being a loner as HE prefered technical books to friends.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Military engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME worked as an engineer for a colonial military. HECAP got to play with weapons, murder-drones, and other 'fun' stuff.
HECAP specialized in repairing and modifying mechanoids' tools. Sometimes HE tested them HIMself.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Coliseum cleaner
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: During the 'Inner Destrian War' fallout, HIS parents were captured and HE was born into a life of slavery. Forced to clean coliseums after bloody battles for money. Watching, waiting, and learning. Coliseums were the only thing HE ever knew. One night while cleaning the coliseum, HIS family was murdered.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Coliseum fighter
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Applying the knowledge that he gained from years around fighters, HE became a successful gladiator in the coliseum that he once cleaned.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Officer cadet
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: From a young age, Bashkire trained to be a leader of men. He enrolled in the Vanu Defense College when he was a boy and became proficient with a range of weapons and survival techniques.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Fighter controller
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: During the Zartha crisis, Bashkire fought across many worlds, providing the vital link between the ground and the air as a fighter controller. During the campaign, he saw friends injured and killed. This mental trauma haunts his dreams to this day, but his aim remains sharp.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Reclusive prodigy
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Growing up on a flourishing glitterworld afforded Holly the chance to fully devote herself to her studies.
Having taken a keen interest in genetic modification and neural augmentation from a young age, she had little time (or desire) for a regular childhood.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Fervent researcher
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
As a young adult, Holly was sure that her planet and its people were nearing their time of transcendence.
A firm belief that her research would be the catalyst drove her to increasingly alarming acts as bureaucrats and bioethics committees worked to stall her progress.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: War refugee
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
A war broke on out NAME's home planet.
Gathering what little food and belongings they could, NAME and his father stole a ship and escaped into space.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Vengeful explorer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
A violent drifter without a home, NAME and his father fought many battles across hundreds of years. HECAP became a grizzled fighter and crack shot.
After his father's death in battle, NAME began exploring the stars alone, seeking his father's killer, on the hunt for revenge.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Work camp slave
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME grew up as a slave to a particularly nasty noble family on a medieval world.
While he received no formal education, the harsh labor regimen made his body strong.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Banished soldier
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME became the most physically intimidating of the slaves, spending his little free time obsessively sculpting his body. His efforts eventually paid off when the lord offered him a job as a personal bodyguard.
Later, when he plotted to use his position to kill the lord and free the slaves, he was discovered and barely escaped with his life.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Disciplined farmer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Drew was the younger of two sons on the family farm, a frontier plot that struggled to turn a profit. Drew's father was a strict disciplinarian, constantly at his sons to work harder and keep quiet. Drew burnt his hand making breakfast once and swore to cook only when his life was in danger.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Stalwart farmer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: With the farm under constant threat from brigands, Drew learned to defend himself with his father's hunting rifle. He also mastered how to construct fences to keep livestock in and the local wildlife out. Drew tried to paint a picture of his home and learned he can only draw scribbles and ducks.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Voyager child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was raised on an R&D starship, and spent most of HIS childhood travelling through the void.
Approaching a mysterious planetoid, the ship was severely damaged. HIS next memory is of the ship heading out of orbit, fully repaired. HE soon developed an unnatural gift for technological research.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Space researcher
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME inherited HIS parents' ship and carried on their research.
HISCAP childhood experiences with diverse cultures allowed HIM to preserve his caring nature despite spending most of HIS life isolated in space.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Vatgrown medic
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Raised to be a combat medic, NAME was trained in firearms as well as medicine. His favorite phrase when coming upon a wounded soldier was "Life or death?" Most chose life.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Genetic scientist
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: After the war he joined a genetic engineering firm. He worked on enhancements for humans and livestock. His experiences in inflicting and healing wounds were very beneficial to his work, but he developed a black sense of humor. This made social gatherings awkward.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Core dilettante
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Candice spent her formative years on a glitterworld in the core region, where she and her friends pursued lives of idle pleasure.
As she grew up, she began to find the life of ease unfulfilling. She decided to look for a more challenging path.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Reporter
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Candice spent many years as an investigative reporter. She was notorious for making chaotic reports from exotic locations.
Although seen as a lightweight by her critics, she managed to break several high-profile stories after lengthy investigations.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Aspiring pop idol
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Min was being trained in song and dance to become the next big pop idol. She grew up being taken care of by company handlers.
She never knew manual labor, but learned a lot about music and social etiquette.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Pop idol
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Min performed and did interviews constantly. She refined her skills in dancing and singing, and became a master of social presentation.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Farm boy
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
John worked on his family's farm, looking after the animals and treating them when they were injured. Preferring hands-on tasks and the outdoors, he avoided softer jobs that might have kept him cooped up inside.
He enjoyed this lonely work, and tended to stay out of people's way and do his own thing.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Unstable butcher
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: John began hearing voices. The animals were talking to him, insulting him. He came to hate them, and eventually killed his furry former friends. He started selling the meat just to get human interaction.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Station whelp
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME spent his childhood as a penniless orphan living on a space station. He managed to scrape by doing filthy jobs and stealing. He became so violent due to poor treatment by his “betters” that he was banished from the station, just to be picked up by space pirates.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Pirate king
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: With no real care for other people, NAME fit in perfectly with the pirate crew that he had once been a captive of. Shortly after becoming one of the crew, NAME began to kill anyone or anything that got in his way—including his crew mates.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Construction grunt
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Growing up in his father's lab, Jackson was given the life of an intellectual elite. He got everything he desired, and price was never an object.
However Jackson did not partake in the luxury given to him. Instead, he pursued more physical, and - in his father's eyes - lower-class jobs.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Military inventor
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Jackson, in a final act of rebellion, left his father's lab and joined the local Imperial military.
He used his laboratory skills to design machines of war. At this he was one of the best on his planet.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Street kid
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Growing up on the streets of the a desert planet, NAME's his only friend was a dog named Rest. The pair scraped by, finding just enough food to survive.
When HE was 13 years old, an interplanetary criminal group took HIM under their wing.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Bandit leader
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME rose up the ranks of the crime organization, eventually becoming the leader of one of their most remote cells of bandits. His dog Rest never left his side.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Student engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
A genius child, NAME was put in a special training program covering aerospace warfare and engineering.
One day, he tried to befriend a squirrel by giving it a bracelet. The squirrel bit him, earning him the nickname “Squirrel Boy.”
NAME came to believe that work involving manual labor is beneath HIM.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Engineered pilot
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
After his province was besieged by one of its neighbors, NAME volunteered for a generic modification program that created pilots for the very fighter craft that he had helped develop. The modifications allowed him to pilot the ship, but also made him less able to focus on the people around him.
By this time, people were calling him "Squirrel."

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Frontier marshal
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Henry inherited a sense of duty from his father, and began a law enforcement career on his frontier homeworld.
He tried to uphold the law with honor, but the corruption and greed of local government officials often discouraged him.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Colonial governor
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Disillusioned by rampant government corruption, Henry ran for governor and won. However, the local gangs and their pet officials soon forced him out of power.
He left the community to return to his life as a marshal.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Mercenary recruit
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Descended from a long line of off-world mercenaries, NAME grew up in a busy trading hub.
HISCAP's interest in the foreign goods at the market often distracted him from his chores and training.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Mercenary chef
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Following in his family's footsteps, NAME was a soldier for hire.
He is a naturally gifted sharpshooter. However, his real passion is in perfecting a new recipe or dissecting a new gadget.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Abandoned child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME was a quick witted, funny child. One day, HE wandered off on HIS wealthy genetic parents, and was ultimately lost in a supposedly unused ore warehouse. Due to cloning technology, HIS parents decided that the time looking for HIM was better spent on just cloning a better son.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Cargo pilot
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME was brought up by cargo hands on a long-haul ore transport ship. HECAP perfected HIS skills at trading and manipulation of people while running weapons between systems.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Traders' child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME grew up in a family of nomadic traders, making a living from selling and buying goods on many worlds.
NAME learned the customs and methods of trade of many cultures by participating in his parents' business.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Space humanitarian
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: After seeing the rampant poverty common on overcrowded urban worlds, NAME decided to dedicate HIS life to helping the less fortunate. This crusade taught HIM how to care for the sick and the hungry.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Corp student
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
De Dion was bred to become an executive officer for the large space trading corporation that owned his home planet. His family had been working for that corporation for seven generations.
At age six, HE started to study at the corporate academy, where he learned to become a loyal follower and a ruthless executive.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Executive officer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was an executive officer for a large space trading corporation. After a failed attempt at manipulating his way up the corporate ladder, he was framed for the rape and murder of another executive and her family.
He was found guilty. However, because of his family's influence, he was exiled instead of put to death.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: VR addict
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Douglas was a VR head - someone who is permanently jacked into the virtual gaming universe by his spinal plug. He moved through his daily tasks barely aware of the physical reality around him. This left him nearly unable to socialize.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Rugby player
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
After years of addiction to virtual reality games, Douglas was saved when the doctors unplugged him.
Unfortunately, they unplugged him during a match of Rugby Rampage 4. The mental backlash merged his real identity and his virtual identity, leaving him with the personality and skills of a rugby player.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Nerd
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was curious about everything. While other kids played tag in the suburbs of their industrial city, NAME read every book he could find about technology, robots, and weapons - whatever looked coolest.
His strong French accent kept him from making real friends.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: State engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME enrolled in the state weapons research program.
While brilliant in his work, he was so enthusiastic in testing his creations that he accidentally wounded some colleagues and was marked as unfit for service.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Rebel slave
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was born into corporate slavery and raised to perform menial tasks for minimum pay. HECAP was just another cog in the machine.
NAME found his freedom by joining a rebel organization whose goal was to break free from their corporate masters.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Combat negotiator
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
After escaping his homeworld, NAME took his skills to the stars.
He chose to operate as a hired gun, working for various rebel organizations, enslaved groups, and merchant enclaves. His specialty was negotiation in combat situations.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Medieval plower
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME lived on a planet where kings and queens ruled with little regard for the peasants beneath them. HISCAP family owned a large farm, but the king took most of the food it produced. This left NAME's family poor, and unable to pay for HIS education. Instead, HE was required to work the fields with HIS parents, and never had time to practice creativity.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Space station cook
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: The space station NAME came from was far from any populated planets, and was in itself understaffed. For this reason, NAME was forced to learn how to cook in order to keep the crew alive. While HE appreciated this learning opportunity, HE didn't appreciate the criticism which came with it, and has had self-esteem issues ever since.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Son of a huntress
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
In the mountains of the planet Ticonderoga, Jon was raised by his tribal mother. She taught him survival skills - trapping, tracking, shooting, skinning, cooking and healing.
His departed father had left behind an old bolt-action rifle, and Jon practiced with it every chance he got.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Space hunter
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Now a man as well as proficient hunter and marksman, Jon yearned for more. He took leave from his birth world, traveling the great expanse in search of exotic game.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Student socialite
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Matis learned politics in an elite training school for socially gifted students on Kalthas IV.
While he was naturally adept at reading and manipulating people, he found no joy in it. He left the academy several years before graduation.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Political assassin
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Matis realized that his true calling was in physical solutions to diplomatic problems. He sought training from the assassins guild on Ceti V.
He was a quick study at the arts of subterfuge and death. He soon earned the guild rank of Deathjack.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Awkward nerd
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Always fascinated by machines, Dave spent his time studying robotics and holography. He preferred the company of his scientific creations to that of other people.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: AI researcher
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Dave was a renowned researcher in artificial intelligence, robotics, and interactive holography. His friendships with the artificial minds he created gave him the confidence to interact with real people, and he soon excelled at personal communication.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Midworld geek
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME grew up in a quiet suburban neighborhood. He was never a master of social interaction, but his interest in computers blossomed into a true talent at an early age.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Army scientist
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME did scientific research for a planetary army. HECAP studied war scenarios and designed weapon systems to help win battles with a minimum of fuss.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Cat herder
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME helped out in his father's cat breeding business, socializing, herding, and feeding hundreds of cats.
When he refused to clean up after the cats, HE was transferred to the breeding science division.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Feline scientist
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME became a renowned scientist in the field of felines. Wanting the best for his animals and specializing in selective breeding, he set out on a journey to find the perfect breeding grounds for his cats.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Scavenger
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME grew up in one of the few remaining cities on a world ravaged by nuclear war.
HECAP learned to survive on HIS own in this post-apocalyptic wasteland by scavenging for technology and supplies.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Space marine
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was recruited into the security forces of an off-planet corporation.
HECAP defended their ships against pirates and engaged in private space warfare contracts.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Vatgrown assassin
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Vas was not made as a man, but a cold hearted assassin. He was bio-engineered by scientists, and trained as a killer. He was bred to have no emotion, no feelings, and no care for who lives, and who dies.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Mercenary
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Vas spent his teenage years as a mercenary, being hired to kill and maim others. He was tall, menacing, and frightening. He could instill fear into the hearts of any man who crossed him, and kill anyone he wanted.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Hive world child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME had an isolated upbringing in an urbworld hive city. His hatred of heights kept him indoors often, and made him an introverted child.
When HE did go out onto the catwalks of the city, HE enjoyed playing war games, becoming proficient with various simulation weapons.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Microbiologist
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
A plague struck NAME's native urbworld. NAME and other researchers revealed that the illness was a bioweapon, but the people turned on them, blaming them for the sickness.
NAME barely escaped his homeworld as it fell into chaos.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Stableboy
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was a stableboy on a medieval planet, mucking dung almost every day to earn his keep.
By the time HE was exiting childhood, NAME had saved up enough money to pay a space trader to take HIM offworld.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Brigand
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME flew with a band of brigands HE called friends. HE even had a ship of HIS own - The Dung Mucker 2000.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Starforce cadet
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Raised on Amen-Ti, glitterworld capital of the Star Empire, Sam Wissa had an easy childhood.
As a youth, Sam decided that joining the Starforce would be his way of giving back to the Empire.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Ace fighter pilot
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME graduated from the Star Academy with honors and distinguished himself as an ace fighter pilot in three campaigns against more advanced aggressor cultures.
However, after one vicious battle, he found himself stranded and his carrier ship destroyed. With nowhere to go, he entered his escape pod and prayed.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Artful dodger
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Robin grew up on one of the urbworlds and had to fend for himself all his life. He never trusted anyone, relying on his persuasiveness and cunning to survive.
He soon became skilled with firearms and knives as well as words.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Assassin
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Robin was specially trained as an operative to be used for high-risk assassinations. His skill with a rifle was unrivalled.
He was eventually betrayed by his superiors when a target found out about the hit and offered to fund their future projects. Robin swore to never trust anyone again.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Pickpocket
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Orphaned and abandoned on the tumultuous streets of his polluted, teeming homeworld, NAME survived by deft hand and fleet foot. A natural born thief and trickster, HE rose to prominence early, running the notorious and violent urchin gang 'Doomben Rats'.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Business gangster
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Staying one step ahead of the law, NAME became a legitimate businessman and silenced anyone who dared say otherwise. As proprietor of brothels, speakeasies and eateries, NAME's good fortune continued while his competition suffered a series of unfortunate and unexplained accidents.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Disaster survivor
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Steven was uprooted when marauders attacked his family farm, destroying machinery and killing farmhands and beasts alike.
After the death of all he knew, he was left in the ruins to fend for himself.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Paramilitary agent
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: After scraping by on assorted shady jobs, NAME joined with a large paramilitary group to fight a war on HIS homeworld. HISCAP role was infiltration and intelligence gathering

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: History student
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: As a child, NAME spent learned many artistic forms including music and novel writing. As HE grew older, HE began to study legends from HIS home world - legends of the lizard-like beings at the center of HIS culture's folklore.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Storyteller
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME traveled his world recounting the legends that he had studied.
Obsessed with the legends of his people, NAME seeks someone who can help him grow scales on his skin, so he too can be as the ancients were.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Noble ward
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was adopted by a prominent noble family after being left on their doorstep by HIS mother.
HECAP quickly learned secrets that passed between the nobles like cheap wine - of worlds beyond her own, languages, cultures and technologies both new and old.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Information broker
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME caught a ship to the next star system and began a life of travel and learning, quickly collecting a massive bank of knowledge from people of all shapes and sizes.
HECAP learned to sell this knowledge for great profit, and became a powerful broker of information.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Feral child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Abandoned on an animal planet as a small child with nought but a blanket with a name embroidered on it, Felix made himself one with the wilderness.
When he was 13, he encountered a team of mineral surveyors, who "offered" him passage off of the planet.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Versatile worker
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Spending his later teenage years in a colony of settlers, he offered what little skills he had to anyone who would take him.
Being a quick learner, he honed many of his skills and, apart from his crippling inability to understand fire, is now a fully functioning adult.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Spoiled child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME grew up the child of an industrious colony manager. In this position, most manual and dangerous tasks were forbidden by HIS parents, but on the rim everyone has to dirty their hands.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Test subject
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Kidnapped as a teenager, NAME was an unwilling test subject in experimental gene therapies for six years. Labs and scientists scare HIM.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Amateur engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME grew up in a family with a military and engineering background. HECAP wanted to join the army but his father didn't like the idea, so HIS interest turned to great flying machines and works of engineering. HECAP secretly hoped that this would one day lead him to a life of galactic exploration.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Aerospace engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME was an engineer responsible for the production of aircraft and spaceships. HECAP focused on improving production lines, and was known for HIS mastery of technical and research issues.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Wild child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was abandoned on a toxic world overgrown with hostile plant life. HECAP became accustomed early to the cold burn of loneliness.
HE learned to fight, but ate his food raw and uncooked.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Alcoholic trucker
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was a space trucker working for Arcknight Industries when he killed his wife and daughter in a crash.
His body was repaired with an experimental nano-genetic therapy. Now his muscles continually regenerate and harden, and every movement tears the tissue anew. He bears the pain in silence.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Hacker prodigy
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Wedge was raised as the only child of wealthy surgeons. After being pressured into accepting a medical apprenticeship, he snapped. He seized his inheritance and went underground to learn how to exploit computer networks. He quickly became one of the most feared hackers on his home planet.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Intelligence agent
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Because of his hacking skills, Wedge was recruited by his home planet's governing body to serve as an intelligence agent. The government trained him in combat, but he prefers psychological warfare.
Government rules proved too strict for him, so he went rogue. His current activities are unknown.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Mad scientist
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME grew up miserable on the plains of a neolithic planet. He found the strength to fight under the teachings of an old, broken scientist.
He quickly learned to play with people's fears, and was nicknamed 'mad scientist'.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: War chief
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME was a tribal gang leader on a neolithic planet. For him, the battlefield is a game, and there is nothing more fun than the fires of war.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Youth delinquent
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was the only child of celebrity sommeliers. Her parents expected her to take up the family profession, but after her third admission to a youth detention center, this career path became unlikely.
While in detention, NAME became skilled at making shanks and developed an interest in orinthology.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Involuntary hermit
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME’s escape pod was jettisoned onto an unexplored region of a frontier world. She eked out a lonely existence with only a herd of muffalo for company.
Later, she was spotted clad in pygmy wombat furs, discussing the importance of hoof hygiene with a group of elderly muffalo.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Hillbilly prodigy
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Born on a cold hillbilly planet inhabited mainly by furred xenohumans, Benjamin grew up to the sound of bar fights and shootouts. Though his childhood was spent playing the banjo and working as a mechanic, his abnormal intelligence made him want something more; he entered medical school at age twenty.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Medical scientist
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Benjamin enlisted as a doctor on a passing science vessel. Roaming the stars with a large crew of xenohumans and transbirds, he did genetic research on encountered species. He developed a deep friendship with one transbird but was forced to leave the ship when the captain dismissed all non-avians.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Midworld sketcher
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was born into a loving but poor family.
HECAP discovered he had an artistic talent which he inherited from his father. HISCAP mother taught him the benefits of hard work and determination. As he grew older, NAME developed a fascination with technology and military history.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Midworld sailor
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME joined his country's Royal Navy. After years as a non-commissioned officer, he eventually cracked and used the skills he had acquired to start a mutiny on his ship.
In the end, NAME was the leader of a large group of trained and dangerous pirates. He henceforth always had chefs to cook for him.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Core world student
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Born a male named Alex, Alyssa didn't fit in well with the other boys. When very young, she preferred creative pursuits, such as crafting jewelry, over sports. She felt she had the wrong body. Luckily, her family and friends supported her sex reassignment; as a teen, she underwent surgery to become a female.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Core world jeweler
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: After Alyssa had completed all of her surgeries, she found that she had a lot of time and energy to dedicate to her passion: trinket crafting. She spent years perfecting her art as a jeweler, then left her home world to sell her wares across the galaxy.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Medieval squire
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: William grew up on a medieval planet as a knight in training. He trained directly under the king's war adviser for most of his youth, and learned to fight with a sword and shield.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Medieval knight
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: William fought for king and country on the battlefield, where he further honed his skill as a swordsman. His greatest glory was leading a charge into an enemy courtroom and capturing the king at sword point.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Star squire
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Born on a medieval word, NAME's first memory is of gazing up into the night's sky.
Ever since, HE dreamed of squiring for a knight amidst the star-filled heavens. HISCAP focus on that vision left HIM somewhat single-minded.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Star knight
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Abducted from his medieval homeworld, NAME later escaped his captors via an impressive display of swordsmanship.
For a moment, as he drifted in the escape pod, his childhood dream of becoming a knight among the stars felt so real. Then he crash-landed.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Drug mule
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Raised in an orphanage, NAME turned towards the gang life at age ten.
He was exploited by the local gang as a drug mule to traffic "substance F" across rival gang territory. He took a bullet or two.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Test subject
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME enrolled in a scientific study that promised it could make HIM smarter. Unfortunately, the side effects were very different than he expected.HE went insane and killed a number of people before escaping his homeworld.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Artisan farmer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME grew up on a HIS family's glitterworld farm. They were one of the last farms on the planet that preferred traditional farming methods to glitterworld technology.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Genetic engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME carried out HIS first genetic experiments on farm animals. HECAP soon grew to become quite skilled in all forms of genetic engineering.
A horrifying lab accident left him with a mortal fear of rodents.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Pampered
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Born on a decadent glitterworld, NAME was given every expensive toy.
This pampered lifestyle caused HIM to miss many basic life lessons. HECAP developed a special aversion to cooking, and always ordered the staff to do the kitchen work.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Ninja assassin
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME performed stiletto-precise assassinations for an interplanetary conglomerate. HECAP was assigned the most complex missions involving disguise, deception, subterfuge, and efficient violence.
A nasty incident with a potted plant and an assassination gone wrong left HIM with an aversion to plant life.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Military child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME grew up in a family with a rich military background. HISCAP teenage years were spent traveling system to system wherever HIS parents were deployed.
Following the tradition of HIS family, HE enlisted at the earliest possible age.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Lazy programmer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME independently developed software that had a competitive edge against local urbworld corporations.
HISCAP legally questionable methods lead to a growing number in unsolved claims of intellectual property theft.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Gang member
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME grew up homeless on an urbworld. HECAP was forced to fight and struggle for everything, making HIM hard and ruthless long before adulthood.
NAME would have stayed in those streets, had HE not been injured in a shootout and had his body confiscated for use by one of the worldwide city's ruling corporations.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Mindwiped assassin
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
The corporation took and remade NAME. They trained HIM into an tool of destruction and subversion. HE took to HIS new life, finding satisfaction in the jobs they sent HIM on.
When HE learned that they planned on disposing of HIM, NAME turned on his masters, killing several and fleeing the planet.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Test subject
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Test subject #11,529,914 of experiment #56,048 spent her childhood in white rooms performing mental and physical tests.
Her only companion was a voice that called itself Mother. Mother rewarded success with praise - and failure with harsh punishment.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Test subject
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME's tests went from geometry to quantum physics, and she could run the grand gauntlet without a scratch.
One day, Mother said that her final test lay beyond the red door, and that even if she couldn't hear her voice, Mother would always be there.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Fire-scarred child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Duster was an active child who lived an uneventful childhood until he fell into a fire and suffered horrific burns to his hands and arms. Although the scars have faded, he can't bear to be in close proximity to fire.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Spaceship salesman
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Duster tried his hand at various jobs, including building space rabbit cages and working at a mutant wheat research project. Finally, he found his true calling as a spacecraft salesman. Specializing in recreational spacecraft, his smooth talk and charming nature served him well.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Tech enthusiast
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Michael had all the latest gadgets as a child. He spent all his time playing games with AIs instead of with other children. He always felt awkward around new people.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: AI programmer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Michael enlisted in the military's robotics division, developing smarter combat AI.
The whole time he was there, he never spoke with another human. He spent all his time conversing with the AI he was developing.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Diplomat's child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was born in diplomatic family.
Travelling often, HE was home-schooled and saw the world mostly through a computer.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: White-hat hacker
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: From HIS computer, NAME helped rid the online world of bad people.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Winerunner
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Abandoned by his parents, NAME was raised by the monks of the Novo Mosteiro dos Jerónimos monastery on Aracena VI.
The monks taught him discipline and hard work. In return, HE would go into the city and 'acquire' exotic wines for the monks' nightly tastings.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Vinho king
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
After prohibition came to Aracena VI, NAME expanded his underground liquor business until it dominated the market on two continents. They called him the Vinho King.
Though HE mostly controlled his competition by masterful political maneuvering, HE was not above the occasional beat-down or stiletto assassination.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Street child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME's drug addict mother died, leaving HIM an orphan at a young age. To stay alive, HE resorted to theft, and when necessary, prostitution. When NAME was caught stealing from a church, the priestess saw a wounded but smart child, and took HIM in to give HIM a second chance at life.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Slave chemist
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME became a gifted pharmaceutical scientist, but was captured by slavers. HECAP was sold to a warlord and forced to create drugs to test on other slaves. This left HIM with deep and troubling questions on the ethics of scientific research and medicine.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Slave farmer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Abandoned as a little girl, NAME was found by a farmer. Being infertile himself, the farmer kept her as a slave. The constant beatings left her scarred and unable to handle violence. After many years, she ran away.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Rocket engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME won a grant to a top school and earned a degree in rocket engineering. After several years working for a space mining company she left to travel and see the universe.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Medieval slave
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Born into slavery, Soren never knew his parents. He eventually escaped from his masters and boarded a military cargo ship, where he was pressed into military service.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Space marine
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Soren joined a squad of space marines known for their brutal efficiency at killing. His last name and his lack of emotion during combat inspired his nickname: Grim.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Foundry apprentice
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME grew up as an apprentice in the foundries of an industrial world. This experience gave HIM metalworking skills and strong muscles, but stunted HIS artistic development.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Combat engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME became a combat engineer. HE built bases, fixed guns, and repaired vehicles for the army - when HE wasn't shooting at people, that is.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Privileged prodigy
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME was recognized as gifted early in his glitterworld upbringing. Luckily, HIS family was in a position to cultivate that genius through advanced education. HIS training included science, leadership, and the arts.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Planetary diplomat
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME's passion and profession was interplanetary politics. HE was a master of social manipulation and negotiation and devoted HIMself to working towards peace, compromise and mutual benefit.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Child prodigy
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: After graduating college at age twelve, Jered devoted his life to becoming immortal. However his research crossed the line when he tried to modify his body using gene therapy and mechanical augmentation. He was arrested and condemned to a prison planet.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Renegade engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
After a daring escape from the prison planet with a small crew of fellow inmates, Jered set his gaze on his homeworld.
He travelled there, recruited more followers, hijacked a space cruiser, and launched into the void.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Bone collector
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Born to a family of fortune hunters, NAME always had a passion for ancient history.
Though never a tough or social boy, HE loved to dig through history books as well as dirt piles.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Osteologist
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
After graduating university at the top of his class, NAME quickly became a well-known and athletic college professor.
With his new found fame and fitness came a sudden reluctance to preform menial labor - such tasks are better left to graduate students.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: G-nome sculptor
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was engineered in a lab as part of the G-nome Project. He was implanted at birth with encyclopedic knowledge of all aspects of xenobiology.
The G-nome scientists nicknamed him Gizmo and occupied him with sculpting. He developed a love of sculpting gnomes and gnome accessories.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Gnomebiologist
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Gizmo was a xenobiology professor in a glitterworld university. He went to conferences and managed an art gallery.
However, he never stopped sculpting yard gnomes, and considers this to be his true profession.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Circus performer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Growing up in the circus, NAME learned a lot of interesting things. More interesting then the balls he juggled were the pockets he picked between shows.
A mistake with some firesticks made him develop a deathly fear of fire.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Criminal kingpin
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME discovered his gift - people did what he said, when he said it. Taking advantage of this, he set off for the rimworlds planets to make a name for himself in the criminal underworld.
Having people do things for him taught him to avoid manual labor at all costs.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Vatgrown slavegirl
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Emmie was vat-grown as a slave in an illegal urbworld laboratory. As a young child, she was taught only to cook, clean and serve her masters. For most of her childhood, she knew nothing else.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Urbworld sex slave
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Emmie was sold into sexual slavery. Having been designed to be inhumanly attractive and too weak to rebel against her masters, she was passed between dozens of owners and knew nothing of freedom.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Gun kid
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Growing up in a urbworld, NAME never had it easy. Every day was a struggle and pollution, hunger, and gangs of older kids.
In the little space he had to himself, he studied his passion - guns, combat tactics, and war history.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Urbworld sergeant
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME's passion for all things militaristic kept with him all the way to adulthood.
After enrolling as a local policeman, he was soon promoted to sergeant.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Feudal lordling
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME grew up on a feudal world that was part of a multi-planet empire. As the son of a high lord, HE enjoyed many privileges.
HECAP learned to maneuver in the both the political landscape and in close quarters combat.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: System lord
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: For NAME, ruling a country, or even a planet, was not good enough. HECAP sought to expand his influence across the system - by legal or extralegal means.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Feudal farm boy
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was the son of a medieval farmer, and was expected to follow in his footsteps. He was brought up as a kind, well trained farm boy.
He lived in an unusual feudal kingdom which co-existed with a midworld society which was itself well-known for genetic manipulation.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Hunter of the king
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was forced to protect his colony in the name of the king after a mysterious outbreak of murderous genetically-modified wildlife.
Despite his best efforts, his kingdom was destroyed. NAME developed PTSD, a hatred of animals and a bad case of technophobia. HECAP was named for the place they found him.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Space fanboy
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME dreamed of space travel. He built his own pretend spaceship from an old police box and went to see the great unknown.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Castaway
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME was a passenger on a routine interstellar transit. When his ship was destroyed, he lived as a castaway on an uninhabited planet for several years.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Glitterworld nerd
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME loved technology from the day HE was born. HECAP had a mechanoid companion which HE tried to modify when HE was 10.
HISCAP obsession with technology meant that HE never appreciated arts or culture.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Energy researcher
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME was working on an idea for rapid communication over long distances. HECAP made an error which destroyed HIS lab and most of the city. HECAP fled the planet to escape the authorities.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: War child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Mushinto's parents were drafted into a civil war in his home country. Growing up surrounded by fighting and death, he became well-accustomed to tragedy and tough as nails. His expressive side, however, never developed.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Bounty hunter
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: When the civil war ended, Mushinto had to find a new way to use his fighting skills. He decided to hunt down war criminals and soon realized that he enjoyed capturing bad guys by any means necessary.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Upper urbworlder
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME had a privileged childhood on a major urbworld. Living in an apartment far above the dense poverty of the city, HE spent most of HIS time reading or drawing the cityscape he saw through HIS window.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Missionary
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME decided to devote HIS life to religious service. HE made a vow of peace and spent several years preaching and serving food in soup kitchens for the homeless.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Idealistic cadet
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Raised in the military traditions of his forefathers, NAME was taught from a young age that he would be a great leader and the hero of the Dichter family.
He excelled at his studies and graduated from the academy with honors.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Mercenary pilot
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME convinced his squadron to abscond with their ships and make a course for the rim worlds. There they could fight for the causes they believed in.
His men were loyal and fought hard, but their ideals soon faded away and their cause became that of the highest bidder.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Child of glass
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was raised underground on a "marble" planet - a wasteland of radioactive asphalt and toxic fallout.
To survive on a planet devoid of life, HE had to learn how to farm underground and how to fight without wasting bullets.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Lone traveler
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
After escaping HIS homeworld on a jury-rigged ship, NAME traveled to new worlds to experience their beauty.
HECAP joined resistance groups and applied the skills HE cultivated on HIS homeworld. HECAP often warned of the nuclear horror HE saw as a child.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Amateur botanist
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Spending many summers crawling through dirt, Christian found he had quite the green thumb. Instead of learning to cook the food he grew, he just grew more and more.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Undertaker
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME roamed the galaxy offering grief assistance to those who've had a recent loss. While he never shied away from physical confrontation, he prefers to confront tough situations with a calm word.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Child slave
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Graham was born to a poor family on a rimworld. His father sold him into slavery at a young age and he was traded many times. A tycoon bought him as part of a child labor force and sent down into mines to look after machines and to work alongside them.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Mercenary
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: After escaping a crew of rimworld slavers, Graham developed a lack of respect for life. He proceeded to sign on to a mercenary group where he developed skills using guns and survival techniques. Graham did dirty work where he found it, and traveled to many worlds.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Adventuring child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Axle was raised to become an engineer. For years, he planned to stow away on a cargo ship and start a new, more adventuresome life.
One night, after his parents fell asleep, he managed to sneak on board a cargo ship just before it left port.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Hired assassin
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Axle was a master thief, working mostly for organized crime. Over time, he made a name for himself and shifted his business into the paid "removal" of human threats.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Video gamer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Ryan was raised in a glitterworld. Everything he wanted came to him. In school he was a social butterfly. At home, he spent his time looking up the newest gadgets and playing his favourite video games.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Spaceship chef
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Ryan got a spot on a ship by becoming the ship's cook. He enjoyed cooking and helping the doctor clean wounds, but he never got used to cleaning the dishes.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Dreaded baby
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME was found as a baby in a crashed spacecraft. According to the ship's data records, HE invented the nuclear device that powered his ship. Apparently, he also invented the sky and the hamburger, and is said to have fathered a race of tasty golden kittens.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Dreaded dude
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Some followers say that NAME and HIS crew of misfits found the Fountain of Youth, many, many centuries ago, and that they caused the extinction of the dinosaurs on many planets.
There's even a religion about them, somewhere, involving noodles and meatballs.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Tech-head
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Standing on the ship hull with his father in an child-size EVA suit, NAME loved space from a young age.
HECAP was put in a Civil Academics Program. While pretending to be like HIS father, HE spent HIS time taking care of plants in HIS messy room. HISCAP nickname was given for HIS love of circles.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Systems engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Like HIS father, NAME was a systems engineer. HECAP was qualified in both colony and ship systems.
When not working, HE would make mechanical figurines, read old books, or occasionally travel to uncharted worlds. Being introverted, HE did these things mostly alone.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Tinkerer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME grew up on a scrap-heap of a planet - the garbage dump of other planets in the system. He learned to make new machines from the dead parts of old ones. With some friends, he eventually escaped on a salvaged and repaired ship.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME found a job as a tinkering engineer on the trading hub planet Irithir. Tough local traders forced him to learn negotiation skills, and he made good profits selling refurbished weapons and tools.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Displaced noble
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Born on an urbworld to the ruler of three megacities, NAME’s prospects looked good - until a violent insurrection overthrew HIS family. Exile introduced NAME to hard work and combat, but some high-born squeamishness remains.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Minister
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME managed to secure an important position in the government of a minor glitterworld. HECAP got used to the opulence, while attempting to keep HIS citizens content. HECAP had ample time for pleasure and indulgence – though HE never forgot how to do hard work.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Chess master
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME loved to play chess. HECAP even earned the nickname Bishop for some of HIS craftier moves.
HECAP never got into trouble - mostly because he was good at not getting caught.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Pirate
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
As a pirate leader, Bishop was well-known for his cunning plans and chess-like traps. HECAP was never afraid to sacrifice a few pawns to capture an important target.
HISCAP name has been linked more then once to strategies that overcame overwhelming odds.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Orphan
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Born on a deep space station, NAME was orphaned at a young age. In the orphanage, he stood up for the weaker kids and fought off the bullies.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Bounty hunter
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME is a self-employed bounty hunter. HECAP spent HIS days hunting space pirates and collecting cash bounties.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Straggler
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Despite being blessed with parental love, NAME hardly knew his parents.
HECAP was frequently left to his own devices which meant more time devoted to exploring his interests…and getting into trouble.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Spiceminer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME made his mark on the universe as a spice miner assigned to the lucrative mining colony of Rural Pen’The.
Little did he know, Benn was about to embark on a career path that would change his life.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Brutal thief
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Growing up in a gang, NAME learned the brutality of the streets.
Knowing that showing weakness could be fatal, he closed himself of to others.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Crime lord
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Through brutality and cruelty, NAME rose to the rank of crime lord.
He relied less on his fists and more on his guns. His reputation spread faster due to his cold-bloodedness and ruthless methods.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Boy soldier
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
War may never change - but the cast of characters does.
Born on a violent urbworld, NAME was trained from a young age to fight the wars of others, and became rather good at it.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Marble doctor
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
On a bomb-blasted world, first aid is often the only aid.
NAME used his medical skills to help the injured and the sick. HECAP believed that while guns and machines may be powerful, a doctor is even more so.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Apocalypse child
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME spent his childhood on a post-apocalyptic world. He fought for survival from a young age, on a planet where trust did not exist.
He told everyone that he had no luck.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Mob henchman
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: After being "saved" from his home world by a slaver ship, NAME was sold to an urbworld crime lord, where he was used as a henchman. He specialized in low-tech beat-downs and intimidation.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Orphan of war
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME lost his family and home early in life. His life became emotionally hollow, but his painful memories drove him to survive.
HECAP took several jobs, but never achieved more than a basic education.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Mech war veteran
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME fought against swarms of rogue mechanoids since he was old enough to enlist. HECAP has bled on half a dozen worlds and has lost more than he cares to recall. These experiences left him hardened, both mentally and physically.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Imperial student
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME studied on an imperial midworld where guns were banned and self-defense study was encouraged. The relative safety allowed HIM to focus on HIS botanical research.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Poison gardener
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME spent almost all HIS time tending to a poison garden and became withdrawn from society.
In that time HE learnt a few safe culinary and medicinal uses for the otherwise deadly plants.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Power-mad scholar
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: "Knowledge is power." These words sparked something within NAME, and came to form his core drive. When not entombed within libraries, HE would take things apart to see first-hand how they worked, with little regard for the border between mechanical and organic.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Artificer rampant
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Fuelled by the thrill of discovery and his own megalomania, NAME set out to invent new devices and improve existing ones, breaking laws and customs as necessary.
HECAP formed a crew to gather materials for HIS work - and to deal with outsiders who might interfere.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Orphan
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Left alone in the world without parents, Kevin did the best he could to adapt.
Having to take care both of himself and younger kids at the orphanage, he learned a lot about humans and how to interact with them.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Neuro scientist
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Kevin worked for a long time to improve the world's understanding of the human brain.
After succeeding in mapping the whole brain, Kevin joined a team of scientist on a quest to map the brains of xeno species.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Abductee
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME was abducted at a young age and forced to do menial labor on a pirate ship.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Pirate captain
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME worked his way up through the ranks of a pirate ship, eventually becoming captain. He leads his crew between worlds, making a name to remember.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Blackjack player
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
The only useful skill NAME learned from his tough military school was card counting. He amassed many enemies by cheating at casinos, becoming ever more edgy and violent as the threat of retaliation grew.
When he was finally caught, they burned half his skin off. He'll never be able to face fire or violence again.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Hedge fund manager
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
A top hedge fund manager on a teeming urbworld, NAME's portfolio grew rapidly as he charmed clients with a sweet voice and devious intent. When the deal turned out too good to be true, he was forced to flee the planet with a bounty on his head.
As he travelled the stars he found a passion in the arts, making masterpieces fit for high society customers.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Academy student
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME went to school like a good space cadet would. He was very tall and was known for his good looks.
Though he worried more about his hairstyle than his grades, he still somehow passed the final exams.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Computer engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Bored of his code-monkey office job and missing the glory days of the Academy, NAME saw a commercial about the frontier where "only the strong survive".
With his wife Morgan, NAME undertook a journey into the unknown.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Aspiring engineer
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME had a fascination with gadgets and gizmos. HECAP took apart and put together almost anything HE could find.
HECAP got used to repairing toys brought to HIM by other children, and even fixed a few devices from HIS elders.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Expert handyman
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME worked as a traveling engineer. HECAP fixed things ranging from a simple communications array to the intricate software harness in his ship's AI meta-core. Nothing is beyond repair for HIM.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Medical student
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME grew up on a glitterworld in a family of doctors and chose to maintain the tradition.
HECAP had few friends, but got along with HIS siblings very well.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Medic soldier
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME enrolled in his planetary army as a frontline medic. He soon knew the horrors of war and was deeply marked by them.
HECAP left the military and his homeworld and began researching medicine and helping those he came across.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: High baroness
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME was born as low-ranking royalty in a large imperial family.
She was placed In charge of running her home planet from an early age, and learned important political and cultural skills in that role.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Exiled researcher
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME's love of robotics was not appreciated in her technophobic empire. The High Cardinal of the system excommunicated her, and she was never allowed to return.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: World slider
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME was raised by a world-hopping band of criminals. HECAP learned not to leave evidence of his presence in case the group had to leave in a hurry. HECAP also learned about medicine and hand-to-hand combat from his fellow criminals.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Villain
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: After rising to the top of his criminal band, NAME was taught the arts of villainy, from handling firearms to developing new weapons technologies. He excelled at bending others to his will.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Medical student
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Born into a long line of doctors, NAME was tutored in all fields of medicine, from herbal ointments to the modern synthetic drugs. HECAP also picked up a healthy disdain for lower class work.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Space navy doctor
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: NAME served several tours as a doctor on one of the few warships defending HIS homeworld. HECAP learned combat skills while fighting occasional pirate boarding parties, and became an expert at treating gruesome combat wounds.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Aspergers rebel
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME grew up as a rebel on an formerly-advanced rimworld devastated by war.
HISCAP Aspergers syndrome meant he struggled with social situations and was incapable of caring, but HE learned hard skills like research and shooting very quickly.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Government agent
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME worked for the government against rebel groups and excelled in this capacity. During HIS training HE was taught firearms, melee combat and medical skills.
Having grown up in a war-ravaged city, dirt, blood and dead bodies don’t bother HIM and HE sees no reason to clean them up.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Shooting coma
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc: Nebulys fell into a coma at a young age and spent years dreaming about shooting. When he awoke, he was useless at most tasks - but he could aim pretty well.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Selfless hunter
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Nebulys was a hunter of mysterious creatures that many didn't even believe existed. Sometimes the people were right - and sometimes they were wrong.
Along the way, he helped people in need.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Psychology student
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
NAME researched new religions and traditions and often dreamt of distant stars.
His dreams prompted him to ask what lay beyond the lights in the sky.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Acolyte of stars
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Ever the dreamer, NAME traveled across the universe to find the thing he felt was calling to him.
HECAP became poorer and poorer, but used every means possible to carry on.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Space smuggler
RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.BaseDesc:
Tater's parents used him to help smuggle contraband between a cluster of rim worlds.
Aided by his small size, Tater became very adept at carrying out his parents' missions, learning weaponry, negotiations, and most of all smuggling.

RimTrans.Framework.Injection.BackstoryIn.Title: Space raider
